Description: Upper body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, possibly a cup with everted rim; interior: alternating reserved and black concentric bands; exterior: at left, trace of handle root; handle zone reserved, glazed below.
Curator's comments: The lack of a rim prevents a definitive identification of the cup as a South Ionian cup with everted rim. However, the fabric and pattern find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type VIII (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116). Hayes' Type VIII is of the same shape as his Type IX (only the interior decoration is different) which coincides with Schlotzhauer's (Schlotzhauer 2012) Type 9a. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.294) (Phase 3)
